alert.note: Alert for Kingman (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 01 at 2:33AM CDT until June 02 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kansas... Ninnescah South Fork near Murdock affecting Kingman County. For the Ninnescah River...including Murdock, Peck, Belle Plaine... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ninnescah South Fork near Murdock. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Minor overflow occurs along both banks. However on the south side of the banks near the river bridge on SE 160th Avenue, flooding spreads out into pastureland to the extent of 1000ft. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:15 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 9.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.3 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Ninnescah South Fork Murdock 8.0 9.1 Wed 2 am CDT 6.2 5.1 5.0 &&
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
